column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////If you've never had deep-dish pizza in Chicago before
column2: Lou Malnati's is one of the classic places to get it. According to the menu
column3: this location in River North is the oldest (established 1986) of its four city locations. Another place to consider is competitor Giordano's. There's a location about a block off the Mag Mile at Superior and Rush.
